ygData.subject: RE: Sound effects discovery (off topic)
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are using a SBLive besure the accleration is not set to full, but standard.  Otherwise you will not get the 3d audio (which has saved my party twice in
ygData.messageBody:
If you are using a SBLive besure the accleration is not set to full, but
standard. Otherwise you will not get the 3d audio (which has saved my party
twice in Sol B from unannounced bug trains).

Rokenn

>From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Sound effects discovery (off topic)
>Date: Wed, 6 Oct 1999 11:38:02 -1000
>
>So are you saying the standard "Multi Speaker" setting is the best setting
>to use? If not, which one?
>
>Galtin of E'ci
>
> > Notice when you go down that list of games with environmental audio
> > presets,
> > they are all fairly old games... introduced before EAX extensions were
> > available. Environmental audio presets are for games that do NOT have
> > environmental audio supports built into the game. EQ uses the
> > environmental
> > abilities of the sblive card already... any preset you use with the game
> > would likely deteriorate your experience.
> >
> > Are you sure the creative labs website isn't just stating that EQ
>supports
> >
> > EAX? (can't check from here)
> >
> > ----Original Message Follows----
> > From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> > On a related note, according to the Creative labs website, there is a
> > preset
> > Environment Audio setting for EQ for the SBLive soundcard. I have been
> > unable to locate this setting. I have been using the default Multi
> > Speaker
> > setting for my soundcard. Does anyone know if an Environmental Audio
> > setting for EQ exists and if so how I can go about downloading it?
> >
> > Thanks
> > Galtin of E'ci
